titleStmt.title: Dǝrsāna sanbata krǝstiyān “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: I) Dәrsanä sanbata krǝstiyān “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians” (Homily on the observance of Sunday, ascribed to Jacob of Serug) (fols. 1ra–27vb), incomplete (?)

title.type: incomplete; 1 or 2 fols. are missing before fol. 8r, fol. 13r not photographed.

msItem.title: I. Dǝrsāna sanbata krǝstiyān “Homily on the Sabbath of Christians”
msItem.incipit: 1ra: በስመ፡ʼʼ… ድርሳን፡ ዘደረሰ፡ አባ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ዘስሩግ፡ በእንተ፡ ቅድስት፡ ሰንበት፨ ዘደረሰ፡ ርቱዐ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ አባ፡ ያዕቆብ፨ ስምዑ፡ ኦፍቁራንየ፡ ኦውሉደ፡ ቤተ፡ ክ[1rb]ርስቲያን፡ በእንተ፡ ዕበያ፡ ወክብራ፡ አበ[sic]፡ ቀደሳ፡ ወልድ፡ አልዓላ፡ ወባረካ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ= ወኵሎ፡ ፈጢሮ፡ አስተናበሮ፡ አዕረፈ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ በዕለተ፡ ሰንበተ፡ ክርስቲያን፨ … 1ra: In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. The homily which ʾabbā Jaqob of Serug composed on St Sabbath, which the Orthodox in faith ʾabbā Jaqob composed. Listen, my beloved ones, sons of the Church, about her greatness and her glory. The Father sanctified her, the Son elevated her and the Holy Spirit blessed her. And having setted to create everything, the Lord rested during the day of the Sabbath of Christians. …
msItem.explicit: 27rb, l.10: ... በጸሎታ፡ ወበ፡ ስእለታ፡ ለቅድስት፡ ማርያም፡ ወለዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ወዮሐንስ፡ መጥምቅ፡ ወጊዮርጊስ፡ ኀያል፡ ገበሬ፡ መንክር፡ ዐቢይ፡ ሰማ[27va]ዕት፨ እስጢፋኖስ፡ ቀዳሜ፡ ሰማዕት፡ አንክሪጦስ፡ ወፃባ፡ ወኵሎሙ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ወሰማዕት፡ እለ፡ አስመርዎ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ በሕይወቶሙ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ አሜን፨ ወአሜን፨ = ፨ ፨ = ፨ = ፨ = ፨ ለዘ፡ ጸሐፎ፡ ወለዘአ[sic]፡ አጽሐፎ፡ ወለ[27vb]ዘ፡ አንበቦ፡ ወለዘ፡ ሰምዐ፡ ቃለቲሁ፡ ሕቡረ፡ ይምሐሮሙ፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፡ ሕቡረ፡ ይምሐሮሙ፡ አሜን፨ ወአሜን፨ ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘ <...> ይጽሐፍ፡ ስሞ፡ ምስለ፡ ደቂቁ፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፨ አሜን፨ ወአሜን፨ <...> 27rb, l.10: ... With the prayer and entreaty of St Mary, Mother of God, and of John the Baptist, and George, big martyr powerful maker of the miracle, of Stephan, protomartyr, well anchored ... (?), and all the saints and martyrs who pleased the Lord with their life. Forever and ever. Amen. Amen and Amen. For the one who wrote it and for the one who caused it be written, and for the one who read it, and for the one who listened to its words, may He have mercy upon them all together in the Kingdom of Heaven, may He have mercy upon them. Amen and Amen. This is the book of <...> May He write his name with his children in the Kingdom of Heaven. Amen and Amen. <...>

msItem.note: A leaf belonging to the Ms. (now foliated 7a) was found in a bunch of leavesUM-038(foliated there as 24 [to be numbered as 7a]) and incorporated into the codex during the conservation work on 25.11.2011. However, some two fols. are still missing.

list.item: 7 The original structure of the quires cannot be established due to the poor condition of the Ms. It can be assumed as follows: A - I(7/fols. 1r-7v)

supportDesc.condition: Condition before the conservation work on 25.11.2011. The back board is broken and repaired. The original sewing is missing; most of the fols. are separate, kept together by crude recent stitches and guards (e.g., 1r, 8r, 13v, 14r, 16v, 17r, 20v, 21r, 24v, 25r, 27v). A few fols. are missing. The Ms. is affected by humidity, esp. in the upper margins of the fols. Some parts of text are washed out (esp. in 14vb ls. 5-13 l.16; 26ra ls. 3-4; 27ra ls. 3-4; 27vb ls. 8-9, 14-16). Before fol. 8, one or two fols. are missing. Crude notes in pen and in pencil are written in the upper margin of most of the fols. Holes in 11, 16, 18.

layout.ab: Pricking and ruling are poorly visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
In fol. 1, the two ruling lines at the top have been not used by the scribe.

list.item: nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text);
doubled nine dot asterisks, with two lines in between (e.g., fols.: 20ra, l.5; 21vb, l.8; 22rb, l.11; 23ra, 12, 15; 24va, l.16; 27ra, l.14);
nine dot asterisks, connected with two lines (esp. 20rb, l.3);
three chains of short lines (esp. 1rb, l.7).
III. Nine dot asterisks, connected with two lines (esp. 27va, 10-11, 14).
Row of four crux ansata with coronis, marking the end of the text (esp. 27va).

handNote.seg: Nomina sacra; three lines (both columns) on the incipit page, alterning with black lines; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals and their elements.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards (back board broken and repaired). Two pairs of sewing stations.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: The name of the original donor has been erased (s. 4va, 5va, 27vb). The name of Gabra Libānos is written over erasure in pen (s. 27vb).

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
